intro: Pfaffia schomburgkii, commonly known as curaçao root, is a perennial herb native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish flowers. The plant produces dark brown, tuberous roots that are the primary part used in traditional medicine. These roots are rich in compounds such as curcuminoids and have been used for their purported health benefits. Pfaffia schomburgkii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and partial shade.
